Issues.Title: @angular/pwa doesn't clean up previous service worker version's cached content
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
The issue is caused by package @angular/pwa


### Is this a regression?

No


### Description

I am noticing that with every new version of my application the cache size grows considerably because the Angular Service worker is keeping the previous versions of the application in cache? This means that everytime you release a new version of your application, the new version's resources will be cached for offline use (the expected behavior). However, all of the cached content (scripts, css, HTML, etc) from the previous versions of the application are still stored in cache. This means that the application's cache will grow exponentially with every release of your application.


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
1. Setup new CLI project ng new my-pwa-app
1. Add PWA support ng add @angular/pwa --project my-pwa-app
1. Build production version of application and run locally (observe cache size)
1. Make small (non-functional) change to the application (just to change file hashing) - representing a new version of your application being deployed.
1. Build production version of the application and run locally again (NOTE: the cache size will be double what it was before). Repeat steps 4 and 5 and this behavior will continue (cache size will continue to grow, because it is holding onto the previous version's cached files).

**Application cache storage (same content, different version):**
Version 1: 12.2 MB
Version 2: 23.5 MB
Version 3: 32.9 MB
...etc.

## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:** 11
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1774477/115428812-ca0c3800-a1d0-11eb-9636-7d53636e0e12.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "@angular/pwa doesn't clean up previous service worker version's cached content" (#41728)

Issues.Title: test(common): synchronise location mock behavior with the navigators
Issues.Body:
do not emit event for imperative navigation.
emit a `popstate` event before each `hashchange` to have the same
behavior of the `history API`.

BREAKING CHANGE:

After this change we should not use location.go to test an imperative navigation, we
have to use route.navigate or route.navigateByUrl methods.
`popstate` will be emitted before each `hashchange` event. We'll need to
remove all `simulateUrlPop` called before `simulateHashChange` in the
spec files.

# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

In the [docs](https://angular.io/guide/singleton-services#how-forroot-works)

> In the [live example](https://stackblitz.com/angular/kopljbedqoee?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.module.ts) / download example the root `AppModule` imports the `GreetingModule` and adds the `providers` to the `AppModule` providers

But in the live example I don't see `AppModule` adding  `providers` to itself as it's stated in the docs (root AppModule imports the GreetingModule and _adds the providers to the AppModule providers_.)


Could you clarify what is meant in the docs? And fix it if it will be required.

### What's the affected URL?**
https://angular.io/guide/singleton-services#how-forroot-works

Issues.Title: build: update stemmer to version 2.0.0
Issues.Body:
NOTE:
`stemmer` v2.0.0 switched to ES modules (see words/stemmer@03519229c84555a38d3256409d1871edfd43528f), which means that the only way to consume it in our CommonJS  setup (for example, in [generateKeywords][1]) is via an async `import()`.

This commit makes the `generateKeywords` processor asynchronous in order to be able to dynamically import and use `stemmer`.

[1]: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/251bec159af1e8f90c3af9820695c645800207e4/aio/tools/transforms/angular-base-package/processors/generateKeywords.js

Issues.Title: build: update remark packages
Issues.Body:
[![WhiteSource Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com) This PR contains the following updates: | Package | Change | Age | Adoption | Passing | Confidence | |---|---|---|---|---|---| | [remark](https://remark.js.org) ([source](https://togithub.com/remarkjs/remark)) | [`^9.0.0` -> `^13.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/remark/9.0.0/13.0.0) | [![age](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/remark/13.0.0/age-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![adoption](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/remark/13.0.0/adoption-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![passing](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/remark/13.0.0/compatibility-slim/9.0.0)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![confidence](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/remark/13.0.0/confidence-slim/9.0.0)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | | [remark-html](https://togithub.com/remarkjs/remark-html) | [`^9.0.1` -> `^13.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/remark-html/9.0.1/13.0.1) | [![age](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/remark-html/13.0.1/age-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![adoption](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/remark-html/13.0.1/adoption-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![passing](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/remark-html/13.0.1/compatibility-slim/9.0.1)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![confidence](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/remark-html/13.0.1/confidence-slim/9.0.1)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | --- ### Release Notes
remarkjs/remark ### [`v13.0.0`](https://togithub.com/remarkjs/remark/releases/13.0.0) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/remarkjs/remark/compare/12.0.1...13.0.0) This is a giant change for remark. It replaces the 5+ year old internals with a new low-level parser: [`micromark`][micromark]. The old internals have served billions of users well over the years, but markdown has changed over that time. micromark comes with 100% CommonMark (and GFM as an extension) compliance, and (WIP) docs on parsing rules for how to tokenize markdown with a [state machine][cmsm]. micromark, and micromark in remark, is a good base for the future. #### Migration - Update all the `remark*` packages you are using in `package.json` - Did you use GFM (tables and so, used to be the default)? Now add [`remark-gfm`][gfm] - Try running it all. If it fails, you are probably using a [syntax extension which hasn‚Äôt been updated yet][plugins], there are issues open on the issue trackers of those plugins already - Compare the previous output to the new output: anything wrong? See below for the changelog which might cover it. Otherwise, It‚Äôs probably because remark is now CommonMark (or GFM) compliant. Please compare with those projects if the new behavior is correct or not ([CommonMark Dingus](https://spec.commonmark.org/dingus/), or [create a gist](http://gist.github.com/new) for GFM). Does remark not match those reference parsers? Please open an issue here! #### Changes ##### remark-parse `remark-parse` now defers its work to [`micromark`][micromark] and [`mdast-util-from-markdown`][from-markdown]. `micromark` is a new, small, complete, and CommonMark compliant low-level markdown parser. `from-markdown` turns its tokens into the previously (and still) used syntax tree: [mdast][]. Extensions to `remark-parse` work differently: they‚Äôre a two-part act. See for example [`micromark-extension-footnote`][micromark-footnote] and [`mdast-util-footnote`][from-markdown-footnote]. - change: `commonmark` is no longer an option ‚Äî it‚Äôs the default - move: `gfm` is no longer an option ‚Äî moved to [`remark-gfm`][gfm] - remove: `pedantic` is no longer an option ‚Äî this legacy and buggy flavor of markdown is no longer widely used - remove: `blocks` is no longer an options ‚Äî it‚Äôs no longer suggested to change the internal list of HTML ‚Äúblock‚Äù tag names ##### remark-stringify remark-stringify now defers its work to [`mdast-util-to-markdown`][to-markdown]. It‚Äôs a new and better serializer with powerful features to ensure serialized markdown represents the syntax tree (mdast), no matter what plugins do. Extensions to it work differently: see for example [`mdast-util-footnote`][to-markdown-footnote]. ###### `options` - change: `commonmark` is no longer an option, it‚Äôs the default - change: `emphasis` now defaults to `*` - change: `bullet` now defaults to `*` - move: `gfm` is no longer an option ‚Äî moved to [`remark-gfm`][gfm] - move: `tableCellPadding` ‚Äî moved to [`remark-gfm`][gfm] - move: `tablePipeAlign` ‚Äî moved to [`remark-gfm`][gfm] - move: `stringLength` ‚Äî moved to [`remark-gfm`][gfm] - remove: `pedantic` is no longer an option ‚Äî this legacy and buggy flavor of markdown is no longer widely used - remove: `entities` is no longer an option ‚Äî with CommonMark there is almost never a need to use character references, as character escapes are preferred - new: `quote` ‚Äî you can now prefer single quotes (`'`) over double quotes (`"`) in titles ##### Changes to output / the tree All of these are for CommonMark compatibility. They‚Äôre all fixes. Most of them are inconsequential to most folks. - **notable**: references (as in, links `[text][id]` and images `![alt][id]`) are no longer present as such in the syntax tree if they don‚Äôt have a corresponding definition (`[id]: example.com`). The reason for this is that CommonMark requires `[text *emphasis start][undefined] emphasis end*` to be emphasis. - **notable**: it is no longer possible to use two blank lines between two lists or a list and indented code. CommonMark prohibits it. For a solution, use an empty comment to end lists (``) - inconsequential: whitespace at the start and end of lines in paragraphs is now ignored - inconsequential: `` are now correctly parsed, and the scheme is part of the tree - inconsequential: indented code can now follow a block quote w/o blank line - inconsequential: trailing indented blank lines after indented code are no longer part of that code - inconsequential: character references and escapes are no longer present as separate text nodes - inconsequential: character references which HTML allows but CommonMark doesn‚Äôt, such as `©` w/o the semicolon, are no longer recognized - inconsequential: the `indent` field is no longer available on `position` - fix: multiline setext headings - fix: lazy lists - fix: attention (emphasis, strong) - fix: tabs - fix: empty alt on images is now present as an empty string - ‚Ä¶plus a ton of other minor previous differences from CommonMark ##### Thanks Thanks to [Salesforce](https://www.salesforce.com), [Gatsby](https://www.gatsbyjs.com), [Vercel](https://vercel.com), and [Netlify](https://www.netlify.com), and our other backers for sponsoring the work on micromark! To support our continued work, back us on [OpenCollective](https://opencollective.com/unified)! [micromark]: https://togithub.com/micromark/micromark [from-markdown]: https://togithub.com/syntax-tree/mdast-util-from-markdown [to-markdown]: https://togithub.com/syntax-tree/mdast-util-to-markdown [micromark-footnote]: https://togithub.com/micromark/micromark-extension-footnote/blob/main/index.js [to-markdown-footnote]: https://togithub.com/syntax-tree/mdast-util-footnote/blob/main/to-markdown.js [from-markdown-footnote]: https://togithub.com/syntax-tree/mdast-util-footnote/blob/main/from-markdown.js [mdast]: https://togithub.com/syntax-tree/mdast [gfm]: https://togithub.com/remarkjs/remark-gfm [plugins]: https://togithub.com/remarkjs/remark/blob/main/doc/plugins.md#list-of-plugins [cmsm]: https://togithub.com/micromark/common-markup-state-machine ### [`v12.0.1`](https://togithub.com/remarkjs/remark/releases/12.0.1) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/remarkjs/remark/compare/12.0.0...12.0.1) - Issues.Title: fix(common): add body as an optional property on the options parameter of HttpClient.delete request (#19438)
Issues.Body:
adding optional body for HTTP delete request options. This new param added as an optional so won't break the existing code also provide the capability the send the body when and where it required.

## PR Checklist

## What is the current behavior?
The HTTP DELETE request does not support the request body.

adding optional body for HTTP delete request. This new param added as an optional so won't break the existing code also provide the capability the send the body when and where it required.

- [x] No

Issues.Title: Template errors after angular version update from 8 to 9
Issues.Body: # üêû bug report ### Is this a regression? Yes, disabling ivy engine from tsconfig.json everything works as expected (v9.1.13) ### Description I am trying to update angular application from version 7 to latest version. For this i am following recommended process i.e. updating application to one bigger version step by step, so till now i was able to update application from version 7 to 8(where application compiles and runs successfully) and followed by version 8 to 9. Since i moved from View Engine to Ivy as rendering engine i am getting template errors for all the templates from application, from which i have attached some of them in a text file below for the reference. I tried running application by disabling Ivy from tsconfig.json file and its running without any problem, but as soon as i enable Ivy it gives template errors all over the application. **I updated package.json file for "postinstall": "ngcc" and executed npm install by removing node_modules files**. Seems like templates are not able to identify the angular tags though i have imported all the required modules into respective modules. ## üî• Exception or Error 382 ~~~~~~~ src/app/layout/components/document/document-search/document-search.component.ts:24:18 24 templateUrl: 'document-search.component.html', ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Error occurs in the template of Issues.Body:
[![WhiteSource Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com) This PR contains the following updates: | Package | Change | Age | Adoption | Passing | Confidence | |---|---|---|---|---|---| | [remark](https://remark.js.org) ([source](https://togithub.com/remarkjs/remark)) | [`^9.0.0` -> `^13.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/remark/9.0.0/13.0.0) | [![age](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/remark/13.0.0/age-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![adoption](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/remark/13.0.0/adoption-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![passing](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/remark/13.0.0/compatibility-slim/9.0.0)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![confidence](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/remark/13.0.0/confidence-slim/9.0.0)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | | [remark-html](https://togithub.com/remarkjs/remark-html) | [`^9.0.1` -> `^13.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/remark-html/9.0.1/13.0.1) | [![age](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/remark-html/13.0.1/age-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![adoption](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/remark-html/13.0.1/adoption-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![passing](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/remark-html/13.0.1/compatibility-slim/9.0.1)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![confidence](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/remark-html/13.0.1/confidence-slim/9.0.1)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | --- ### Release Notes
remarkjs/remark ### [`v13.0.0`](https://togithub.com/remarkjs/remark/releases/13.0.0) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/remarkjs/remark/compare/12.0.1...13.0.0) This is a giant change for remark. It replaces the 5+ year old internals with a new low-level parser: [`micromark`][micromark]. The old internals have served billions of users well over the years, but markdown has changed over that time. micromark comes with 100% CommonMark (and GFM as an extension) compliance, and (WIP) docs on parsing rules for how to tokenize markdown with a [state machine][cmsm]. micromark, and micromark in remark, is a good base for the future. #### Migration - Update all the `remark*` packages you are using in `package.json` - Did you use GFM (tables and so, used to be the default)? Now add [`remark-gfm`][gfm] - Try running it all. If it fails, you are probably using a [syntax extension which hasn‚Äôt been updated yet][plugins], there are issues open on the issue trackers of those plugins already - Compare the previous output to the new output: anything wrong? See below for the changelog which might cover it. Otherwise, It‚Äôs probably because remark is now CommonMark (or GFM) compliant. Please compare with those projects if the new behavior is correct or not ([CommonMark Dingus](https://spec.commonmark.org/dingus/), or [create a gist](http://gist.github.com/new) for GFM). Does remark not match those reference parsers? Please open an issue here! #### Changes ##### remark-parse `remark-parse` now defers its work to [`micromark`][micromark] and [`mdast-util-from-markdown`][from-markdown]. `micromark` is a new, small, complete, and CommonMark compliant low-level markdown parser. `from-markdown` turns its tokens into the previously (and still) used syntax tree: [mdast][]. Extensions to `remark-parse` work differently: they‚Äôre a two-part act. See for example [`micromark-extension-footnote`][micromark-footnote] and [`mdast-util-footnote`][from-markdown-footnote]. - change: `commonmark` is no longer an option ‚Äî it‚Äôs the default - move: `gfm` is no longer an option ‚Äî moved to [`remark-gfm`][gfm] - remove: `pedantic` is no longer an option ‚Äî this legacy and buggy flavor of markdown is no longer widely used - remove: `blocks` is no longer an options ‚Äî it‚Äôs no longer suggested to change the internal list of HTML ‚Äúblock‚Äù tag names ##### remark-stringify remark-stringify now defers its work to [`mdast-util-to-markdown`][to-markdown]. It‚Äôs a new and better serializer with powerful features to ensure serialized markdown represents the syntax tree (mdast), no matter what plugins do. Extensions to it work differently: see for example [`mdast-util-footnote`][to-markdown-footnote]. ###### `options` - change: `commonmark` is no longer an option, it‚Äôs the default - change: `emphasis` now defaults to `*` - change: `bullet` now defaults to `*` - move: `gfm` is no longer an option ‚Äî moved to [`remark-gfm`][gfm] - move: `tableCellPadding` ‚Äî moved to [`remark-gfm`][gfm] - move: `tablePipeAlign` ‚Äî moved to [`remark-gfm`][gfm] - move: `stringLength` ‚Äî moved to [`remark-gfm`][gfm] - remove: `pedantic` is no longer an option ‚Äî this legacy and buggy flavor of markdown is no longer widely used - remove: `entities` is no longer an option ‚Äî with CommonMark there is almost never a need to use character references, as character escapes are preferred - new: `quote` ‚Äî you can now prefer single quotes (`'`) over double quotes (`"`) in titles ##### Changes to output / the tree All of these are for CommonMark compatibility. They‚Äôre all fixes. Most of them are inconsequential to most folks. - **notable**: references (as in, links `[text][id]` and images `![alt][id]`) are no longer present as such in the syntax tree if they don‚Äôt have a corresponding definition (`[id]: example.com`). The reason for this is that CommonMark requires `[text *emphasis start][undefined] emphasis end*` to be emphasis. - **notable**: it is no longer possible to use two blank lines between two lists or a list and indented code. CommonMark prohibits it. For a solution, use an empty comment to end lists (``) - inconsequential: whitespace at the start and end of lines in paragraphs is now ignored - inconsequential: `` are now correctly parsed, and the scheme is part of the tree - inconsequential: indented code can now follow a block quote w/o blank line - inconsequential: trailing indented blank lines after indented code are no longer part of that code - inconsequential: character references and escapes are no longer present as separate text nodes - inconsequential: character references which HTML allows but CommonMark doesn‚Äôt, such as `©` w/o the semicolon, are no longer recognized - inconsequential: the `indent` field is no longer available on `position` - fix: multiline setext headings - fix: lazy lists - fix: attention (emphasis, strong) - fix: tabs - fix: empty alt on images is now present as an empty string - ‚Ä¶plus a ton of other minor previous differences from CommonMark ##### Thanks Thanks to [Salesforce](https://www.salesforce.com), [Gatsby](https://www.gatsbyjs.com), [Vercel](https://vercel.com), and [Netlify](https://www.netlify.com), and our other backers for sponsoring the work on micromark! To support our continued work, back us on [OpenCollective](https://opencollective.com/unified)! [micromark]: https://togithub.com/micromark/micromark [from-markdown]: https://togithub.com/syntax-tree/mdast-util-from-markdown [to-markdown]: https://togithub.com/syntax-tree/mdast-util-to-markdown [micromark-footnote]: https://togithub.com/micromark/micromark-extension-footnote/blob/main/index.js [to-markdown-footnote]: https://togithub.com/syntax-tree/mdast-util-footnote/blob/main/to-markdown.js [from-markdown-footnote]: https://togithub.com/syntax-tree/mdast-util-footnote/blob/main/from-markdown.js [mdast]: https://togithub.com/syntax-tree/mdast [gfm]: https://togithub.com/remarkjs/remark-gfm [plugins]: https://togithub.com/remarkjs/remark/blob/main/doc/plugins.md#list-of-plugins [cmsm]: https://togithub.com/micromark/common-markup-state-machine ### [`v12.0.1`](https://togithub.com/remarkjs/remark/releases/12.0.1) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/remarkjs/remark/compare/12.0.0...12.0.1) - [`6543d08`](https://togithub.com/remarkjs/remark/commit/6543d08) Update [`unified`](https://togithub.com/unifiedjs/unified/releases/tag/9.0.0) (**breaking**, please see its release section) ### [`v11.0.2`](https://togithub.com/remarkjs/remark/releases/11.0.2) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/remarkjs/remark/compare/11.0.1...11.0.2) See [`remark-parse@7.0.2`](https://togithub.com/remarkjs/remark/releases/tag/remark-parse%407.0.2) and [`remark-stringify@7.0.4`](https://togithub.com/remarkjs/remark/releases/tag/remark-stringify%407.0.4) ##### Project - Issues.Title: ng new fails due to @babel/traverse
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [x] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, it worked yesterday with 11.2.9 but today it does not using the same version. ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ```sh docker run --rm -it node:lts bash npm install -g @angular/cli ng new test --strict --routing --style scss ``` ## üî• Exception or Error 
npm ERR! code ETARGET
npm ERR! notarget No matching version found for @babel/traverse@^7.13.17.
npm ERR! notarget In most cases you or one of your dependencies are requesting
npm ERR! notarget a package version that doesn't exist.
npm ERR! notarget
npm ERR! notarget It was specified as a dependency of '@babel/helpers'
npm ERR! notarget

npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:
npm ERR!     /root/.npm/_logs/2021-04-21T02_07_30_591Z-debug.log
‚úñ Package install failed, see above.
The Schematic workflow failed. See above.
The error would make you think maybe a version of this package was removed from the node repository. However, when I checked it still seems to be there, and if I try to install it alone, it works just fine: ```sh npm install @babel/traverse@^7.13.17 ``` > \+ @babel/traverse@7.13.17 > added 25 packages from 46 contributors and audited 25 packages in 2.078s > found 0 vulnerabilities ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): disable Webpack 5 automatic public path support
Issues.Body: The Webpack 5 automatic public path support can cause an incorrect public path to be used to load assets and lazy loaded routes. The current logic relies on the last script element found at runtime in the application's index HTML which may not be related to the application scripts. Now if a `deployUrl` is not specified, the Webpack `publicPath` option is defaulted to an empty string which provides equivalent behavior to Webpack 4.

Issues.Title: TerserPluginOptions incompatible with webpack 5
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Description Build angular project with webpack 5: `ng build myProject --optimization=true`. When using webpack 5 and the latest TerserPlugin, the options passed have changed and cause the Terser plugin validator to exit with an error. The angular builder TerserOptions (`sourceMap` and `cache`): https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/076ab0f11fe63cdac4271733af03c7844860ebff/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/webpack/configs/common.ts#L380 The TerserPlugin webpack 5 options no longer have `sourceMap` and `cache` sourceMap removed: https://github.com/webpack-contrib/terser-webpack-plugin/commit/393f249f341e66fd7acc06d558d58c3d2953e4c9#diff-bfe9874d239014961b1ae4e89875a6155667db834a410aaaa2ebe3cf89820556L41 Cache removed: https://github.com/webpack-contrib/terser-webpack-plugin/commit/ddff508ceeaf65e69cb43543aa640eb76a75394d#diff-bfe9874d239014961b1ae4e89875a6155667db834a410aaaa2ebe3cf89820556 If you hook into the plugin and remove the two keys from the options before it's validated, the app builds fine and is optimised accordingly. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Package.json: ``` "resolutions": { "**/@angular-devkit/build-angular/webpack": "^5.0.0", "**/@angular-devkit/build-angular/css-loader": "^5.0.0", "**/@angular-devkit/build-angular/dotenv-webpack": "^6.0.0", "**/@angular-devkit/build-angular/html-webpack-plugin": "^5.0.0", "**/@angular-devkit/build-angular/style-loader": "^2.0.0", "**/@angular-devkit/build-angular/terser-webpack-plugin": "^5.0.0", "**/@angular-devkit/build-angular/webpack-dev-middleware": "^4.1.0", "**/@angular-devkit/build-angular/webpack-virtual-modules": "^0.4.2", "@storybook/builder-webpack4/webpack": "4.44.2" }, ``` ## üî• Exception or Error 

Invalid options object. Terser Plugin has been initialized using an options object that does not match the API schema.
 - options has an unknown property 'sourceMap'. These properties are valid:
   object { test?, include?, exclude?, terserOptions?, extractComments?, parallel?, minify? }
## üåç Your Environment 




Angular CLI: 11.2.2
Node: 14.16.0
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 11.2.3
... animations, cdk, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core
... elements, forms, language-service, material
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: 

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1102.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1102.2
@angular-devkit/core            11.2.2
@angular-devkit/schematics      11.2.2
@angular/cli                    11.2.2
@schematics/angular             11.2.2
@schematics/update              0.1102.2
ng-packagr                      11.2.4
rxjs                            6.6.7
typescript                      4.1.4
**Anything else relevant?**

Issues.Title: Out of the Box Compatability with Web3 / Crypto, @angular-devkit
Issues.Body:
This is a FEATURE REQUEST to implement the out of box capability to run an Angular application that utilizes web3 for creating decentralized applications. 

When the web3.js package is included and used within an Angular app, the Angular build produces the error:

```Module not found: Error: Can't resolve 'crypto' in ...```  which may also include ```Can't resolve 'stream' in ...```

The proposed solution is changing the **browser.js** file in *@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/webpack/configs/* on line 119 from ```node: false``` to ```node: { crypto: true, stream: true }```.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Out of the Box Compatability with Web3 / Crypto, @angular-devkit" (#20566)

Issues.Body: See each commit

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): change several builder options defaults
Issues.Body:
BREAKING CHANGE:

A number of browser and server builder option defaults, with the aim to reduce the configuration complexity with the new production builds by default initiative.

**Browser builder**
| Option                                 | Previous default value    | New default value |
|----------------------------------------|---------------------------|-------------------|
| optimization                           | false                     | true              |
| aot                                    | false                     | true              |
| buildOptimizer                         | false                     | true              |
| sourceMap                              | true                      | false             |
| extractLicenses                        | false                     | true              |
| namedChunks                            | true                      | false             |
| vendorChunk                            | true                      | false             |

**Server builder**
| Option        | Previous default value | New default value |
|---------------|------------------------|-------------------|
| optimization  | false                  | true              |
| sourceMap     | true                   | false             |
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): change several builder options defaults" (#20569)

Issues.Title: [11.2.x] perf(@ngtools/webpack): only check affected files for Angular semantic diagnostics
Issues.Body:
This change improves the performance of incremental type checking of Angular templates by reducing the number of calls to retrieve the diagnostics.
Only the set of affected files will be queried on a rebuild. The affected set includes files TypeScript deems affected, files that
are required to be emitted by the Angular compiler, and the original file for any TTC shim file that TypeScript deems affected.

Patch version of #20348

Closes #20558
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[11.2.x] perf(@ngtools/webpack): only check affected files for Angular semantic diagnostics" (#20563)

Issues.Title: Several `ng update` fixes
Issues.Body:
**fix(@angular/cli): run all migrations when updating from or between prereleases**
    
With this change we consider the update schematics are idempotent. When updating from or between prereleases we will execute all migrations for the version.

**refactor(@angular/cli): clean up left over @schematics/update code**


**fix(@angular/cli): ignore `tsickle` during updates**
`tsickle` doesn't be a dependency in users projects, if it is most certain it will cause updates to fail due to mismatching peer dependency on TypeScript.

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/cli): Support XDG Base Directory Specfication
Issues.Body:
Reading throw  #16034 the angular config should be placed in the `$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/angular/` directory, but if the environmental variable $XDG_CONFIG_HOME is set the first check in the `xdgConfigHome` function will only put it in `$XDG_CONFIG_HOME` instead of the `angular/` directory.

Also renamed the config file from `.angular-config.json` to `config.json`  when it is in the `~/.config/angular/` directory since it doesn't need to be hidden.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular/cli): Support XDG Base Directory Specfication" (#20556)

Issues.Title: bug(MatRipple): mat-ripple-element is not fired correctly on disable
Issues.Body:
Working on resolving a bug that `MatRipple` stuck in the focus state. When on disable, sometimes the ripple cannot fade out the ripple in time. After investigation, it seems that there is opportunity when the `mouseup` event is not captured before setting to disable and `mat-ripple-element` is not fired correctly . 

#### Reproduce the error
[Live example in stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-idn9y3?file=src%2Fapp%2Fbutton-ripple.ts)
##### Step to reproduce
1. Immediately click the icon button when move the cursor on it.
2. Try couple of times if you cannot see the state stuck after you move away the cursor.
3. Try more times after you reproduce it - you will see the color of the state becomes darker, since multiple `mat-ripple-element`s are not fired correctly.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82900738/115483284-56d0e900-a205-11eb-8672-c1e7a8d6e970.png)

#### Expected behavior
`mat-ripple-element` should be always deleted on mouse up 

#### Environment
Angular Material: 11.2.9
rxjs: 6.6.7
Browser: Chrome
Operating system: Mac

#### Fix
On disable, it should call `fadeOutAll()` method to make sure all `mat-ripple-element`s are fired. So I propose to have this change on the ripple `disabled` variable:
```typescript
  set disabled(value: boolean) {
    if (value) {
      this.fadeOutAll();
    }
    this._disabled = value;
    this._setupTriggerEventsIfEnabled();
  }
```
If this is approved, I will go ahead and create a pull request.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatRipple): mat-ripple-element is not fired correctly on disable" (#22520)

Issues.Title: BUG(select): Dropdowns are not accessible on iOS devices with VoiceOver. Critical
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction
URL: https://material.angular.io/components/select/overview
Version: 11.2.9
All mat-select dropdowns. 

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open VoiceOver on an iOS device and swipe to the first mat-select dropdown. 
2. Double-tapping to expand, and swipe right to go to the first option (or if an option is already selected, focus usually starts there).
 

#### Expected Behavior
1. On step 1: VO should read: Dropdown label + combobox (+ selected value)
2. On step 2: Dropdown should expand and VO should announce that the dropdown is expanded + focus should go directly on the first option (or selected option if a value is already selected).

#### Actual Behavior

1. a) On step 1: VO only reads Dropdown label.
    b) If float-label is set to never, then VO skips entirely the dropdown, non-sighted users would never know that the dropdown exists.
2. Once dropdown is expanded, VO doesn't announce it, when user swipes right, focus moves in the background instead of the options inside the expanded listbox.


#### Environment

- Angular: Mat angular 11.2.9
- CDK/Material: Mat angular 11.2.9
- Browser(s): Safari
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): iOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "BUG(select): Dropdowns are not accessible on iOS devices with VoiceOver. Critical " (#22509)

Issues.Title: fix(material/paginator): add `role="group"` to host
Issues.Body:
In testing `<mat-paginator>` with VoiceOver, I found that the interaction was much nicer when the paginator controls were semantically grouped with `role="group"`. This change adds the role and updates the documentation to explicitly instruct users to apply a meaningful label.

I was on the fence about adding a default label (something like "Pagination control"). I settled on this approach because it's the most consistent with our other controls that require developers to specify a label for host elements, even though we do have `MatPaginatorIntl` for the labels for child components within the control.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/paginator): add `role="group"` to host" (#22512)

Issues.Title: bug(cdkDropList): cdkDropList doesn't pick up dynamically added connected dropLists.
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

We have a use case where we must dynamically add extra cdkDropList on the fly. In the [this StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/cdk-droplist-sample-1)  this is simulated by a ngIf. 
When you drag an item from folder-2 to folder-0 folder 1 will open, but it doesn't accept the items. However, if you move it first to 0 then to 2, and back to 1, it will suddenly do. The same goes for eventual multiple added lists.

 
#### Expected Behavior

The behavior one would expect is demonstrated in [this StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/cdk-droplist-sample-workaround?file=src/app/app.component.ts).
While this is working it's using undocumented internals, and forcing the connectedTo in 2 different ways, where I can not predict long-term stability.


#### Actual Behavior
The actual behavior is demonstrated in the first linked StackBlitx. 
When we go from this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1249083/115239341-e51e6f80-a11e-11eb-8b8b-897ab594e1be.png)
to:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1249083/115239399-f49db880-a11e-11eb-8901-34f725a097b0.png)
The folder-1 isn't accepting the item dragged on top of it

#### Environment

- Angular: 11.any
- CDK/Material: 11.any
- Browser(s): all
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  all
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdkDropList): cdkDropList doesn't pick up dynamically added connected dropLists." (#22508)

We would have to double-check that none of the overlay options are actually bad/impossible for any single overlay-based material component.
